summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions. It details the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have conspired with Ghislaine Maxwell to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14, with abuse occurring at his residences.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's disregard for the law.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and law enforcement partners for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a Manhattan federal court indictment with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors and with perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein exploited girls as young as 14, enticing them to travel for illegal sex acts during this period.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with making several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiracy related to the sexual abuse of minors with Jeffrey Epstein, as well as perjury.
The indictment alleges the abuse occurred from at least 1994 to 1997, with victims as young as 14, at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
Maxwell is alleged to have played a critical grooming role by befriending victims, taking them on outings, discussing sexual topics, and being present during abuse to normalize it.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions related to the alleged acts.
The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan and is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Public Corruption Unit.
